all
cleanliness and attentive staff.
minor A/C issues. room was hot but my kids room was changed although they moved them one floor down I worried that we were not on the same floor at least.
Every thing was awesome especially the nice staff and great food
just needing the food reservation at 9 am

Staff was friendly and resort was clean.
Entertainment were good everyday.

Food was terrible and same everyday. Not at all good when you go for all inclusive drink at bar were average. All restaurants in resort had terrible food and had to do reservations for dinner and most of time didn't got reservation. Had to order food from outside.
Employees were always very nice and helpful. The food was delicious. Restaurant reservation went smoothly each time at 9 a.m. We felt save all the time.

The hotel is located directly at the port, from where the ferry to Isla Mujares starts, so you can hear the ferry and smell the gas from time to time. It is written in the hotel description so we were not surprised by that, but still a small discomfort. In the afternoon the animation was a bit loud. We had a good time in the hotel

I would like to share the way I was treated on the reception the day of my arrival. 
I came to CDMX on a business trip and decided to extend my stay and enjoy Cancún for a couple of days. The day I arrived in Mexico, my credit card was robbed, which is unfortunate but manageable given that you can still use the bank’s app or Apple Pay. I am aware that contactless payments are not yet that common in Mexico, so was keeping it in mind when booking my stay in Cancún. I chose a non refundable all inclusive option precisely for that reason. Booking’s confirmation clearly stated that the hotel will charge me in advance. They didn’t. 
When I arrived at the hotel, a lady at the reception, I think her name was Fabiana, stated that they only accept physical cards and when I explained that won’t be an option and asked which solution they can provide, her reaction was hostile and she started to repeat over and over again that they only accept physical cards. She didn’t smile, she was rude in the way she spoke and I felt humiliated to say the least. She finally told me I should write to their accounting guy to explain the situation and ask for help. I repeatedly asked to assist with writing an email (why would she assume my Spanish is good enough to do that) and was openly denied any help. She couldn’t respond as to how soon the email will be replied and was constantly demonstrating that she’s doing me the favour by simply talking to me. Why should I go through all that stress after being awake from 4 am for an early flight and have to deal with this kind of attitude. 
I finally got the response from the accounting person and the payment was settled - I was provided the link to pay online. I showed a confirmation email received from the payment system. Fabiana said that it will take time to process the payment and that I should wait. To my question how long it might take, she responded she doesn’t know, as simple as that.

By then, I’ve been STANDING at the front desk for 1.5 hours. I wasn’t offered to have a seat, I wasn’t even offered a glass of water. 
Another hour passed and I went to ask about the payment. 15 minutes more and I was granted with Fabiana’s attention and she decided to contact the accounting to confirm the payment. Would she even do it if I didn’t chase her? 
Finally everything was confirmed. Not even once was I offered an apology for the inconvenience. 
I would like to make it clear that my complaint is not about the hotel not accepting contactless payments (however, why wouldn’t a 4* hotel in one of the most touristic places ever?), not even about the fact that the payment wasn’t done in advance as indicated. It’s about how this situation was managed by your stuff. It was unprofessional and left a bad aftertaste for the rest of my stay. As a solo traveller, I felt insecure and vulnerable during those first moments in the hotel, I didn’t feel welcome. It was a very stressful and spoiled first day of a long waited vacation.

Great room and view of the sea with a balcony and beach bar nearby.
Staff are excellent. 
Breakfast is best - great selection of foods and views of beach. 
Staff always attentive. 
Nice big walk in shower. Spacious room. TV with lots of channels, some English. 
Wifi good throughout room and hotel. 
Beds were good, extra pillows, two beds in room of Queen size. 
Laptop size lock box in wardrobe.
Buses to town every 2 mins for 1USD.
Drinks in room are topped up daily - water and low quality beer, with tiny bag of nuts and tiny choc covered wafer biscuit.
Great choice of food. Breakfast is great.

Annoyed that the hotel tries to rip off it's guests.
Liquor is low quality (inc the tomato juice).
Red wine undrinkable (like vinegar).
If you want better quality whisky etc (I dont mean 25 yr whisky) then pay 5 USD per drink! (eg black label).
Don’t book trips at the booking area next to concierge person. It’s price gouging. Use booking.com.
They'll book a taxi for you for 55 USD - taxi rank outside costs 35 USD.
Booking desk people will try to put you on a timeshare trap: i.e. go for a free lunch at sister hotel via free taxi, have a look at villa, then hard sell. They have sellers in the foyer. Claim "free gift" of 2 for 1 massage (110 USD instead of 220!) or 30% off trips (original price written on paper with your 30% savings = BS).
Use USD primarily, or Mex pesos. Don’t use your card in markets.
In Cancun and region, expect to tip everyone for anything, anywhere.
Expect high environmental taxes for any trips. No receipt (I asked) but seems genuine on gov web sites.
Sandy beach is stony so bring sea shoes.
Wifi: need to re-login if take phone away from Hotel (complete 5! fields: name, room, code etc). Annoying.
Shower control was worn out.
Curtains drag to close/open (corroded).
Light switch for whole room didn’t work.
Hotel shop is price gouging eg small nivia suncream is 20 USD. Sea shoes - rubber feet -35 USD a pair (10 USD in town).
High price: 1400 USD all inclusive for 7-nights.
Long walk to nearest 'corner' shop 10 mins (overpriced).
Nothing in Cancun city to look at (we asked a local and I checked on Google: except more souvenirs).
Take ear plugs as the music is loud most of the day and from 8-10pm. Good for young adults, not older adults.
Lots of Americans (not  friendly).
Lots of overpriced souvenirs everywhere – no ID where made – likely China).
Food usually warm not hot.
No sandwich pack if you go on a tour but you can get a burger bun, apple and small cake.
location and service was great !

I wish the beach was bigger it’s close to the ferry so they have a small beach part roped off. I wish there was a swim up bar in the pool so you don’t have to keep getting out to get drinks. also there are 4 restaurants and you have to make reservations to 3 in order to eat inconvenience.

The price was right, staff were good, facilities were clean, pool was large, lots of beach and pool chairs and a good variety of food and drink options. There is a Mexican, Italian and Seafood A-La-Carte Restaurants as well as the typical buffet that doesn't require reservations. The Mexican restaurant was a disappointment, Very bland, which is unacceptable given it's in Mexico and Mexico has some of the most flavourful food on Earth. The seafood restaurant was just OK, but the Italian was very good and the buffet was quite good as well. There is also a main bar and a beach bar, both which open at noon and close at 11pm, which means it isn't party central so that was nice.

The main thing with this hotel that is important for everyone to know is that the beach is very small, right next to the Ferry terminal (I mean RIGHT NEXT TO) and the water is not turquoise at all. If you are going to Cancun for the world-class beaches, this location will absolutely NOT meet your criteria. However, if you want an all-inclusive that isn't party central (bar doesn't open until noon and closes at 11pm) and has a beach area with very swim-able water, then this may be for you. We enjoyed our stay but next time will definitely be more conscious about this quality of the beach. The
Customer service
Timely manner in the operation of the bar and restaurant
Cleanness, food

The receptionist was really sick. She made a mistake, charging the wrong amount. Never send a cancellation to my credit card. I have to dispute the charges. In a time of Covid, the people can't work when they are sick. It was scary.
Great Beach and location. Great view of the ocean from ocean room. Staff very attentive. Clean. Really happy with the stay.
The food was mediocre, but apparently not unexpected for all-inclusive food. Loud until about 10/11pm, but not unexpected from other reviews.
it was located close to the xcaret ferry to isla mujeres
beach wad trash, food was abysmal  and not palatable

The food was amazing, the staff was super friendly and fun. The room was nice and the bed comfortable. Nice big shower. The drinks were great too. It's a small resort, with a sizeable pool and small beach with enough shade to chill and read.

The beach is right next to a ferry terminal. The ferry was quite loud and the smell of the engine was sometimes disturbing. 
For the 5 days we were there it was fine. But if we plan a longer vacation I would probably choose a bigger resort with evening shows and away from any ferry terminals.
Spa, location of facility, friendliness of staff.
The music was too loud in the evening.  The noise level was too loud for us to sleep.

Located in a small beach
All inclusive
Close to the airport
Big rooms

Beverages wirh artificial flavor
Paid for wines at the diner
Few fish options in the normal menu
Room to loud beside the staff
Mini bar too loud in the night
Likes that it was located away in a quiet area and not in the busy area.
Have no dislikes
It was very nice resort lots of things to do & always clean or seen people cleaning all hours of the day. All employees were courteous n polite
That drinks were limited times/hours we could get them & then pay more for certain brands....all inclusive if was there we should been able to get it!
location
my room was wet as in humid and noise from the air conditioner. The front desk staff were very grumpy and with a police attitude .
The location was good. We were able to leave the resort and walk to the little shops
The stretch of beach wasn’t long.
It was a basic all-inclusive. Free drinks, free food, nice room.
We stayed only one night , so from our limited experience was maybe on the outskirts on the hotel zone, which may be a good or bad thing.
This is a smaller resort so everything was pretty convenient.  There were always chairs available at the pool and beach. Bars were great.

Buffet and snack bar food was not great. Not enough variety, pretty much the same everyday with new names. Breakfast omlettes were not good at either the buffet or the restaurant. One day at the restaurant we were told we couldn't order omelets it was just the buffet. The buffet ran out if breakfast sausage so they brought out cut hot dogs and called it sausage.
Very good
Smell in the toilet
The Mexican restaurant that require reservation is probably the best experience I had during our stay. Food is awesome and staffs are simply amazing.

Somehow, the front desk sent two separate families to our room within a hour, and of course our door cards became useless when they made new cards for those two families. We waited in line for forever to get this resolved. And because all this, we missed beach opening hours the first day. Also my friend lost her headphones and never be found. Buffet food is ok, bar drink is ok
The activities, staff and sea foods were great.
We couldn't get our ocean or at least a pool side view as requested.
it’s a beautiful structured building, there is food 24/7. the night shows are great, the activities and entertainers were very nice

check in and check out took way too long. they have a horrible system were they do everything by paper and it’s very weird. ppl were in line at least an hour no matter how busy it was. I have never had this issue at a hotel so I thought it was odd that instead of getting with technology you were literally doing paperwork that took a half hour after being in like an hour.

The hotel itself is ok, if you’re going to spend most of the time on excursions, it’s a good option.
The buffet is good, the drinks are fair.
The front desk staff are not the friendliest. it gets too crowded and they seem overwhelmed.
Price value was the one to take
The Chek in process was so long and inefficient

The staff is the highlight of this resort. Warm as the Mexican sun and always at your service with a smile. There were some that were so special I would like to mention them by name. 
Lucy the towel attendant at the pool has a smile and personality that will make your day. Pepe and William in the buffet restaurant. María de la Cruz at reception is amazing. Erik Gonzalez in the seafood restaurant will entertain you with some very cool service tricks and his laugh made me laugh. Finally Roberto the concierge, he will guide you well. 
the restaurant food for the most part was quite good.
The beach is not the gorgeous Cancun blue you see in the brochures and the location is a bit far from anywhere to walk to.
Overall, it's good. But it needs to be improved of check in procedure and reply to the customer messages.

Check in it's waiting too long. We spent 1 hour just for the line up. Plus they asked us to pay 50% as a deposit a month ago which it didn't say in booking.com. And when we checked in they had nothing on the system, so the front desk had to call their financial department after I showed them a transaction recipe(not an official recipe because I have nothing after I paid online). All this was unnecessary, if they can just write a note on the system. Plus, I messaged them to have a confirmation after I paid a 50% deposit, but no reply at all.

I loved that the staff was friendly and entertaining, check-in was easy and quick. We didn't get to check in until about 4 PM, but they gave us our bands and we were able to enjoy the resort. The beach and restaurants were clean. You can enjoy the sunset in the lounge area by the ocean. They made great drinks. The food was great. Especially the seafood and buffet restaurants.
The Mexican receptionist was very rude, my husband and I had a 2 small beds in our room instead of a queen or king. I literally left there with a crook in my neck. The Spa was okay, but expensive.
The open water
Food choices
First time to Cancun. The weather was great always in the upper 80’s. The property was nice. The buffet was great! The atmosphere and the staff was awesome and very welcoming!!
The only complaint, would be the gnats. The gnats were mostly in the bathroom around the sink area. There wasn’t a lot, maybe 5-6 a night, but enough to be annoying.

the property is nice and pretty . the place is very clean and the staff is amazing. the beach bar wouls be funner if they had a speaker . the food was baddddddd . i tried all the restaurants and buffets …. not good at all . overall the vibes and the staff made the time i spent great ! thank you
the food was terrible
The view was gorgeous
the staff was great and the grounds were super clean

the rooms looked like a prison cell. no pictures on the wall, bare minimum for furniture, the rooms were surprising after seeing how great the pool, lobby and surrounding facilities were. also food was just so-so.
location
the beach
Location....easy access by bus to local stores and shops.

Everything about the hotel stay was great. It was exceptionally clean and staff was always pleasant and courteous. Good quality entertainment, fun pool/beach side activities and great gym. The checkin/checkout process was easy and pleasant. The buffet was very good and the restaurant food was outstanding. The beach is well maintained with daily removal of seaweed.

The location next to the busy the marina with a large ferry and four pirate ships was not great because of frequent diesel fumes on the beach. The restaurant reservation process should be moved from 7 am to 9 am or later, to allow guests to rest on their vacation.
meals, layout of resort, location, staff
check in process to hours

Very beautiful resort. The food was pretty good. The beach-front view from our room was amazing. The staff was polite and helpful. Most of them spoke some English.  It's a great place if you like to day drink and relax. There is beach-side service which is really nice. It's really easy to get around town on the big red local bus.

The steak was weird and rubbery. The hot tub was really cold! Booking.com gives you the option to choose two beds or one, but you really don't have a choice what the resort chooses to give you. They try to get you to upgrade rooms so that you can get what you booked in the first place. There weren't really any activities in the resort or on the beach. Everything shuts down around 10pm. There weren't many people under 40 years old around. You have a very small window of time to make a reservation at the two on-site restaurants (10am to 1pm).
staff super friendly security always watching you
no one told me it was against the police to bring in outside food
Nice hotel and very Confy rooms. Organisation of day tour at good price !

Breakfast is slow.
No possible to swim in the sea as they have blocked the access with big bags.
The location and on-site parking were very convenient. The terrace was nice as well. The breakfast buffet has a lot on offer as well. Access to the beach and the pool are both convenient.

We booked a suite with a sea view and received a partial sea view. Our room also had drainage issues in both sinks and the shower. The hotel lobby is pretty rundown and the melon smell is overpowering.
Very nice beach, great breakfast. Staff is friendly. The bus stop is right in front of the hotel that can take you to other parts of zona hotelera.
Location, cleanliness

The woman at the eggs station was very rude, I was waiting for my eggs and then my mom came by and asked for an egg, the lady annoyed said “ you have to do the line” but there were just me and my mom in front of the her… 
Very impolite and almost pissed off

We loved our room, in the tower, facing the sunrise.  BUT, we had to upgrade to get that.  The room that they gave us for booking.com was a crappy room, I think they give bad rooms to booking,com and then get you to upgrade
Deluxe room is not good.   Maybe booking.com gets the crappy non-renovated rooms…because that is what we were given, until we upgraded another $50usd per night.  That was a surprise.

Hotel is very well located and the beach is great. I chose this hotel because I had planed to visit restaurants outside. I did not eat in the hotel.
Master suite is very comfortable and with great view of the ocean. All personal is helpful.
It is great to have massage at the beach and have a bed by the beach. Drinks and service in the beach is great.

The hotel looks neat and tidy. 
Seems like very well renovated.

The only downside of the hotel, was one gentleman from bell boy staff, who was kind enough to help us with luggages, but kept waiting and insisting us to tip him. 
That’s not how the staff should behave.

We loved the property, the staff was all so nice and accommodating. Even the beach lifeguard was exceptional, kind and very informative. Our room was upgraded and we had a beautiful room huge bed on the ground level with views of the pool. The best part was at night when the bar closed you cloud hear the waves from the ocean.

Our stay was pretty good until our door broke on the last day and it ate into the time we planned to go to the pool and getting ready to leave. But the maintenance team acted quickly and fixed it an hour before check out. Our first all inclusive stay in Cancun and I didn’t like the additional charge on things deemed premium, I would rather pay extra upfront or opt for the non inclusive and try some the the restaurants nearby.

I really liked the beach and the delicious breakfast.
also the view from the room was beautiful
a bit old

The service is good, the location is great for moving to other places and the food was nice. Once you stop asking for soft drinks and you are a bit more specific into whisky, mezcalitas, margaritas, etc.. Cocktails are great. The sushi bar was beyond expectations. The breakfast was AMAZING!

The bedroom was different from the one that it's shown on the page, they have the new and old rooms but never tell you so; then we got one of the old ones, that were in good state and comfortable but non-updated at all (old phones, old bathroom, old equipment). We selected this hotel because of the restaurants, when we arrived they told us that both restaurants were available after 3 or more days in the Hotel, that's something really quick to fix by adding the information to the summary.
Location

Rigidity around chrxk out. Some flexibility not more than an hour extension
 should be considered . Staff was absolutely rigid about that.
The service!

we have been here long time ago and you can se great progress of reconstructed part. We really like this hotel because of location and to be truly honest it is not that big as other hotels in this location and you can see they take care of you (even more). Staff was very friendly, especially around pool, beach and Deck restaurant. Rooms very specious and beautiful. We will come back soon.
So much noise from the streets at nites

The property was located fairly close to the Main Street, so you could catch a bus without walking a mile from the property to the highway. The staff was super helpful, the property was very clean our room was always clean. We paid extra to be ocean front and it was a pano of the ocean. My husband and I have been going to Cancun for over 30 years and this is one of the prettiest stretches a beach. Additionally the food was very good it wasn’t that cafeteria dorm style food. Each night was something different.  Hamburgers and cerviche and other great things were available for lunch, but the breakfast was perfect.
The property itself wasn’t the most luxurious with Marble in modern furniture etc. but it was comfortable and nice. There are also two pools a loud one in a quiet one. We will return.
fantastic location, close to the nightlife, bar staff and waiters were fantastic, the all inclusive is definitely worth the money, on a nice stretch of beach

our room wasn’t as described or as per the pictures, the pictures that were shown on the master suite wasn’t what we got, we got a two bedroom room with a limited view. communication could be improved.
Nice Beach, good view (sunset view superior room),excellent breakfast.

We arrived around six pm and we weren't told that there would be no more towels at the beach/pool area. So we needed to go back to the room (quite far away) and use the regular towels, although they told us we could get some at the reception (which was not the case). No welcome drink and quite difficult to get up to the hotel (no elevator but help from hotel staff). Pool area not a lot space in comparison to number of guests but there is plenty at the beach.
staff were very friendly, beautiful location, nice dining options, clean and comfortable rooms! Was a great end to our trip in Mexico.
nothing

We felt like we got great value for money on an all inclusive package with free flowing cocktails, wine and beers. The breakfasts were a definite highlight as was our evening at the Italian restaurant which felt a little special thanks to the violinist.
The staff were all so friendly and the barman at Magic Bar in particular worked so, so hard!
The beach was very chilled and pool lively with lots of games and music etc so something for everyone.

We thought we had a balcony in our room as it said the type of suite we booked came with one but we didn't. When we asked to change the hotel was full that evening and then we didn't want to repack the next day. Our room was also adjoined to a group and it could be quite noisy.
We were up early due to jetlag so this didn't matter to us but most sunbeds were gone/reserved with towels by 7/7.30am.
too few sunbeds on the beach compared with number of guests.. all sunbeds are somehow already reserved at 8am with towels on them
location
price
Great location, good beach front property.

We had to switch rooms because of dirty sheets and dirty box spring. Also the food was not that good and the drinks were definitely watered down. We ended up eating at nearby restaurants to compensate.
Great location on the beach, room was in great shape and very clean. Had a nice view of the bay

Service was not great, waited a long time for food and bar service. The restaurants and bars were not crowded enough for the long waits. Also when booking on here the prices are listed as per room, but then they make you pick one or two people staying in the room
Beachfront, all inclusive pricing
Food can be better for lunch, needs more vegetarian options
the beach, clean room, great service and sea view from the balcony
They put a lot of effort on food but still not delicious besides the Sushi bar
Thoughtful hotel and staff, they sent champagne and cake to the room on my birthday. It was not expected.
Beach was beautiful, basic but nice all inclusive with lots of options. Staff were friendly and overall it was a nice hotel.
There were never any sunloungers available the pool. People were allowed to just leave towels on these all day but nothing appears to be done about this.

Friendly staff. 
Amazing breakfast.
Great location.
The hotel setup was amazing. Loved the pool area and beach. Breakfast that was included was delicious.
We didn't get the all inclusive package and felt somewhat judged by the staff.
Delicious food on every restaurant and buffet. Nice staff. A lot of entertainment for adults. Great location and very good price. A lot of beach chair.
Little bit noisy in the night, because concert end late. Lack of place for drying swimming clothes.
The food was very good and probably, the best of all hotels I have stayed in. The staff was so kind.
We didn’t have the booked room the first night.
the size of the room is perfect and the room was very clean. The bed is really comfortable!

two televisions in the room while one remote is for both of them when you press a butten it effects both. weird. only one TV (not the one in from of the bed) has Netflix connection. the breakfast is nice but nothing spacial compared to other hotels in Cancun. small pool.

The hotel is right on the beach and has a pool next to the beach. We only spent one night here before a flight so didn’t get chance to see too much of the surrounding area or spend too much time at the hotel (we went to Isla Mujeres for the day). The main areas of the hotel are very clean and spacious. It seemed there were activities throughout the day. The breakfast is really good with loads of choices. If you just want to spend time at the beach, the location is good. Our balcony was spacious and looked out over the pool/sea.

The room we stayed in was dated and not very spacious. The shower leaked from the bathroom into the main room. If you want to do other activities in cancun, you need to take a taxi and they are quite expensive.
We loved how close to the beach the hotel was.  We also loved the food at the restaurant and especially the hot chocolate.  The staff was very helpful and checkin was easy.
Rooms are a bit worn down.  But clean
Beach and activities . The staff are the best, really nice beach
Facilities is compact , my room is really noisy, hard to sleep. They should have double panel glass door.
The hotel and rooms were very clean and spacious. Staff is phenomenal and very attentive. Excellent service.
The elevators are super small, so not enough room for persons with luggage. The beds hurt and stairs since not enough room in elevators to take on. rooms are out dated

Nice swimming pool and easy access to the beach.
Spacious car park.
Great animation from the hotel staff.
Food quality ok, but could definitely be improved.
accommodations, facilities, breakfast, ease of access
only complaint is too few beach chairs/umbrellas available for guests & the water was more rough than expected. we really had to travel off property to be able to enjoy the beach/water

It has no ambiance. Very noisy.
convenience
small room
Clean quiet and comfortable.  Good value for the price.

Hotel could go back to supplying glasses in the room.  Also I seem to recal going down to the front desk and receiving ice on request.
However there were two things that did bother us.  Our room always smelled like fish.  And the door stuck all the time!
Location , maids, and servers worked hard to ease you.

The policy  regarding masking, having to walk through a spray mist device was uncalled for when covid cases are not spreading and deaths cemetery down. And in green zone around the world. Time to get things back to normal. Let your staff breathe wo a mask.  I want to see them smile.

Location is excellent.  Testing location 1 minute away.  Walmart 1 min away.  Las Americas mall across the street, 15 min walk over a bridge for people.  Convenience store next door.  Multiple food locations nearby.  Easy 25 min travel to airport.  Staff friendly.  Rooms small but expected at this price.  Clean, efficient, friendly, ease of use for 1 might stay excellent.   Would not use for prolonged because not near beach or tourist.  Perfect for an overnight, fly out the next day, hotel.
N/a

Bed was decent
Air conditioning was great
WiFi was excellent
Shower was good

Breakfast is awful
You can hear noise from the corridor outside your room due to poor soundproofing around the door
Location for airport easy access, local shops and great shopping mall
Hot bedroom, poor air con. Cannot open windows, small rooms. But it is a ibis and you know what your getting
Very clean, comfortable beds and pillows

The room and the beds were very small. I booked a room with two double beds, but they were not double, much smaller.
No hand towels in the bathroom or bath mat.
Great breakfast, very helpful staff
Not in the best location, room was not completely clean
ok room, good location for a night to get your flight. They have also a lot of restaurants, shopping mall and supermarket close by.
hygienic could be better and it’s a very big hotel you have to like it.

Ivan was exceptional in attending to my details questions especially enduring I was to contact my book transfer or taxi arrived.
I stay in IBIS CANCUN CENTRO in a room at the 4th floor and was given delicious mexicana cuisine for all varieties as breakfast, filling and nourishing too.
No food for evening...  as a Nigerian visiting for the first time. It was difficult to find good food around the hotel. I recommend you cook for us also in the evening as well please.

Excellent location, close tu bus station, very central and close to Downtown. Got cheaper food close to and also a new mall next to the hotel. 
Room was clear, the relation btwm price and quality of service is very high. good to stay just sleep and go to Cancun tours. 
you could find a 7 Eleven just 50 m far away.
The buffet was amazing and the staff were quick to solve any doubt or inconvenience we may have. The staff was also very nice and helped us with any special request.
I have inough for my time in the hotel.
Easy to get there
tried to book the airport shuttle with them but ended up taking a taxi on my own. very unreachable even asked booking.com to call.. still no response…
the bathroom needs renovation
breakfast was nice , hotel is perfect location
Check in time 15.00 , Should be 12.00
There could have been glasses in the room as well as ice available.
cheap and accessible to the hospiten Cancun.  THE POSTERIA restaurant next door is AMAZING.  Rooms super clean.  friendly staff

had to switch out key twice.  a bit annoying.  no ability to get cash or exchange money.   beds were OK. But not super comfy.  no toiletries, obviously.  very basic room.  but safe, comfortable and inexpensive
Hotel is located downtown amd has some restaurants around and a shopping mall walking distance. Breakfast in the hotel is good !
The rooms had kind of a smell and the building is old. However is not bad for 1 night transit.
location and breakfast
the double beds are super small. not enough for two people
lLocation was good
Pretty basic, but good value for the money
The location
The room does not have fridge nither a table.
location
facility and rooms
ibis are the MacDonalds of Hotels.  Everything is as you would expect; small functional rooms; limited snack bar/restaurant; attached to shopping mall.

Generally I am alone when I have stayed in these hotels but this time the rooms are really too small for two people.
Generally the snack bar offers alcohol and is open until 11:00 or 12:00.   I couldn’t even get a glass of ice for a drink in my room at 8:00 pm.
the location
everything looked old and beds were not comfortable as well as the size of the room was way smaller than we thought
Location for the airport and plenty of restaurants.
There was about a period of one or two hours that we didn't have running water.
Looks good and clean
The rooms are pretty simple
A shower with shower hose
Bathroom shower is very narrow, once you open the water there’s no room to move around and get wet with cold water.
Excellent breakfast. Small rooms but It is OK for the price
small rooms
City Center
Room were small, but the staff was friendly and helpful. We liked our stay overall.
Big price for small rooms
Good for the ADO, room very basic, but clean
location
humidity and smell in the room
Not sheets sets complete only the cover sheet for mattress not good for higiene reason all hotels put set complete and not tissues paper and not shampoo and hand towels!!!!😡😡😡😡

Friendly staff. We were looking for a hotel for an overnight stay. We flew in in the evening and were taking a bus to another destination the next morning. It was fast to get a taxi to the ADO bus terminal.   Our room was fairly expensive - $190 CAD for such a simple small hotel room, but it was near New Years. It was  safe and clean and 10 minutes by taxi to the ADO bus terminal, so it suited our purposes.  The  grocery  store located right at the entrance to the hotel was very convenient and helpful. There is also a big shopping centre  across the road which could be useful for guests but wasn't for us with our late arrival and only an overnight stay.

We did not have bottled water in our room. Luckily we had our own water. We mentioned this to the reception, but they could not find any for us. There were no good restaurants right  in front of the hotel, but we were able to get something to eat in one of the restaurants that was there, so there was food for tired hungry travellers. We had a late arrival from the airport and an early start to go the the bus termina the next morning, so we did not want to explore the neighborhood for  a better restaurant. The included breakfast was ok.
the location is good if you stay in Cancun city. the vow of the city is nice

the facility is not at all close to any other ibis standard 
high price for what you get
Tidy room, central location, restaurants and grocery stores nearby

The room has a weird musty and stale smell. 
Too expensive to call a taxi
Location and the view from the room
Breakfast -nothing special
Helpful employees.
Have to pay additional for parking. Small room and the AC is really noisy.

Good location a couple streets over from the "centre". Really nice courtyard, the room was large and the beds pretty spread out. Quiet at night. Close to the bus station (which is why I chose it). I would stay here again.
The pool was great
the wifi wasn't working

Superior double room eas way better than Standard double room we stayed for 2 nights before upgrading. And it was literally an upgrade with spacious room. Nice view from the window to the garden and swimming pool area. Very comfy bed.

Very thin walls you can heat everything what is happening outside the room. 
Lack of light in the room.
The room I stayed in was nice 'Tequila Sunrise' with feature window well and curtains around individual beds. I also enjoyed the pool and a few of the guests and staff.

When I wanted food on arrival, I requested a menu at the bar and went to order. However, I was told that the bar restaurant is not in operation at present, so i had to find a restaurant. The main light also didn't work in my room.
location, availability, staff, amenities
coworking was getting renovated on my last stay but I really enjoyed it on my previous stays. could use a quiet phone booth though.
The location is very good. The place is nice with many possibilities to sit outside. Nice and helpful staff.
common areas were beautiful especially the pool area. Staff was exceptionally nice. Awesome location.
The private double room was a little sparse. A bedside table with lamp would have been nice.
The house is beautiful and has many common areas. It is a very calm place for those who want to relax and work. It's clean and organized.
The locker in my room was broken and the shower was not heat up. I missed some hangers in the room as well...
Personnel was friendly and helpful !  Location clos to ado terminus 👍.
The staff were brilliant. Especially Javi, Alejandro, Emilio, pichu, carol and Hector!
Room needed a fridge

The outdoor facilities were really nice and tranquil. I enjoyed chilling around the pool and having a couple days of downtime following a big wedding weekend. The location was a cab ride or 30 minute walk from some more commercial bars and restaurants and a short cab from the livelier area of cancun so it was reasonably decent location for the price paid. However we made use of the local restaurants and bars which were very good and cheap!
Our room was very basic and felt a little damp in the air. The bed wasn't the most comfortable.
la decoración afuera
que no tenían un coffee shop y breakfast included

I liked the decoration, the gardens, the swimming pool, the guest's kitchen, the restaurant, bar, the attention to detail, the layout, the LOW music that didn't bother any time of the day and the location was amazing! Overall A VERY BEAUTIFUL hostel, comfortable with very friendly and helpful staff.

The mattress was a bit uncomfortable, not a really comfortable mattresses, all the pillows were very uncomfortable and they were bulking up and I had a lot of trouble to fall asleep because of this.
The kitchen could be improved, it was poorly stocked up, needs a toaster, a blender, more knives, it only had ONE CUTTING KNIFE, the pans were old and dented, all would stick to them, the fridges weren't enough to store food for so many guests and staff.
The shower head was blocked and had very little pressure, therefore very slow to shower and rinse.
friendly staff

Very nice hostel in the city centre close to restaurants, ADO bus station and Parque de las Palapas where there was Taco festival during the weekend we stayed there (delicious local mexican food, music and live dance performances by locals). We stayed in a private room. Nice decor throughout the property and great for remote working. Very friendly and helpful staff.

- our room (Stoli) had great wifi reception
- staff were really friendly and helpful answering questions etc
- location was perfect for what we were looking for, close to everything we needed during our stay. 
- shampoo, conditioner and body wash provided in our private bathroom, was really nice. 
- big windows with the plants outside it, felt very calming.

- location: close to ADO bus stop and locals bus stops, Market 28 and Parque de las Palapas (best local food for dinner options!!) 
- staff: really friendly and helpful with any questions 
- grounds: really nicely kept gardens and plants, just a really nice hostel!
- our room (Fernet) had little to no WIFI
we loved how the space has been designed, the swimming pool is always available, they got extra activities like yoga classes and you feel in line with the nature.
the water in the bathroom was cold and is not ideal when you want to take a shower.
Had the most amazing sleep after almost 20 hours of traveling. It was very quiet and almost had the room to myself which was great. Hostel is very beautiful and clean
Everything was fine. The only thing I can imagine is that it’s not a very sociable hostel. For me it was fine but I can imagine for other travelers this can be an issue.
simple yet comfi, stratégic location to / from the Airport
Only stayed for a night after arriving in Mexico. Easy to access from the airport by the ADO busses. Good beds and pretty quiet in my case.
facilities are great!
rip you off at checkin, by using outrageous conversion rate to pesos :)
Wifi worked very good and the common areas were fantastic. Patio had plenty of places to sit/lay and enjoy the beautiful surroundings. Pool and staff were good too.
Room cleaning was not good, in fact, the bathrooms were dirty. Sheets and coverups were not given to me and the room was cold.

Great place to stay in Downtown. The co-working space was great to get a bit of life admin done. The pool was set in a tranquil space and the water was very nice. Many great restaurants around the hostel and within 10min walking distance. Our room was very nice with a big bed and good shower (no hot then cold nonsense).
Nothing to dislike!
Beds in the dorms with the curtain and the lock are juste perfect and Leonel was very friendly at the reception.
the location and the hotel are really good, but they doesn’t have any service. Like coffee, restaurant even they cancel the activities
they doesn’t have any service. Like coffee, restaurant even they cancel the activities
Needed more than 1 mirror in the room.
Loved the rooms, cleanliness, privacy, security,everything.
Nothing as much
Location is great, 5 minutes walk from ADO busstation. We loved the shower and comfy bed in the private spacious bedroom.
Nothing. Great stay if you are are travelling to the following destination the next day.
Great staff,  clean,  fresh,  nice place.  It was my second stay.
Place is cozy and looks good, a lot of space for networking on the territory. Cleaning every day in rooms.
Paperthin walls
Friendly staff. Good wifi. Nice clean bathroom.
our room overlooked the pool, so it was rather noisy until the pool area was shut.
Beautiful hostel exterior with a pool, hammocks, nice seating areas and lots of space! The room was spacious and the air conditioning was perfect. The staff were friendly.

The bar was closed and there weren’t any events or social activities going on at the hostel, so we found it very quiet. The shower was mostly cold, our ‘room with a balcony’ didn’t have a balcony and the window looked into the corridor.

amazing style of the hotel
great amenities
a lot of plants, wood, mexican elements
room is very stylish & cozy

no mini fridge in the room

confusing part about 3 Nomads hotels within same area and slightly different names (it was my first time in Cancun, i got to the wrong ‘Nomads’ at first lol)
The location is quite central (very near bus ado terminal) and the rooms are quite spacious and clean. The bed was also very comfortable.
There was a pool right outside our room where a party was happening which was not ideal as we wanted to rest and have some privacy.
Great location, close to Mercado 28, bar on the same street is amazing. The pool is well maintained,  feels very secluded and calm.

No hairdryer. It might be our bad to not research the deal properly, but it was a total bummer to find out after the shower:D Also, the water flow is a hoax :D The shower feels like washing under the tap; on top - it takes ages for water to warm up. It took a full shower under the cold water for me, until it turned warm; so my spouse could enjoy a warm shower after me, whilst I was freezing.

WiFi don't work good. Cleaning is not amazing but in the kitchen area is even worst

Really nice and well placed, the room was clean and the bed confortable I enjoyed to stay there

The hotel is in a great location, close to bus station, food and shopping and some of the local markets are within walking distance. The set up is unique and very appealing and charming. If we come back to Cancun again, we'd definitely stay here again. Our only complaint is that the room we were in was very bright at night due to the hallway light shining through the curtains. (We were in the room called Sambucca))

Great location just down the road from Caracol beach. Lovely gardens, lagoon view.

I wanted to stay longer without using Booking com as was unable to re-book my same room via Booking on that day for some reason and reception could only do a much higher rate than Booking com, so was given an email address to contact, but after 5 days still not had reply to my email. I have obviously moved on to another hotel. this is predominantly a hostel and their system is less geared to the hotel side of their business it seemed. David at pool bar very attentive and reception guy did try his best but computers (and Booking com) all said no!

Common area of the hotel and the pool are pretty nice and beautiful. And the free classes they offer are also something outstanding. The vibe of the people and the place are just amazing! I haven't got any but the tattoo shop is something really interesting.

Cleanliness of the accommodation (floor, fan, ac, bathroom) is something they got to improve but nothing disgusting. And also the condition of the lockers is something that should be hard to control but can also improve.

Excelent location, close to nice beach. Room much better than expected (we were upgraded). Nice to have small kitchen space.

Room was very dark. Overall design/decor could do with a little update in the rooms. Poor shower design (floods the bathroom). Expensive to get to/from by taxi (but taxi's are a rip off everywhere in this area).
Anyone reading this tyring to figure out how to get to/from here: Getting to the ADO bus station costs 500 pesos by taxi. If going to the airport it should be 700 (I'd recommend going directly by taxi - much quicker and about the same price, or cheaper if travelling with others).
swimming pool area is very nice

very noisy (very young population)

Food at the restaurant was amazing. Staff were friendly.

my check in was only at 15 and, I had nothing to do until then, I felt lost, and that the staff didn’t help me get comfortable. They saw I was falling asleep on the couch, and then they woke me up telling me I can’t, I felt helpless, alone, just arrived in Mexico.

the bathroom is not clean and the rooms have no sound proof so you will hear everything from out side and the corridor

1.- The internet connection at the co-working space was AMAZING. For 2 days I had to do some on-line work and meetings for and they have 2 no-noise phone cabins for that purpose. I had no problem AT ALL.  They also have coffe and tee for free at this co-working space. I stayed at the 7 building and WiFi internet connection was PERFECT. 
2.- Pre-paid breakfast is OK, it could be a bit more generous. It was just coffe, a couple of options as main course and a tiny side dish (potatoes).   
3.- If you're looking also a place close to the party area in Cancún, this is the spot. There's a supermarket close to it and restaurants as well.
It is ok for a couple of days or if you will use it just for sleeping.
good location, cute exterior, pretty views, fun bar
rooms needs updates, some issues with the bathroom.

The facilities were great with lots of options of classes to do and a complimentary drink on arrival. The location was ideal very close to the party scene in Cancun. There was some cool murals all over the hostel.

The bed was too small for two adults to share. The room was not very clean as there were dead bugs on the ground. The music DJ playing very loudly around the pool area from 12pm until the late evening was not a feature that we enjoyed particularly.
good location and affordable for the area
dirty pool, poor food, tired pool chairs. bathroom wasn’t cleaned well and staff gave away my email to someone who has since tried contacting me

Rooms cleary need a renovation soon, equipment and bath have lots of signs of usage, musty smell in the room. All in all too expensive for what you get in my opinion, actually not worthy for a "Marriot".
We (as probably most people) used this as a stopover for a connection flight the next day, for this it is fine but I wouldnt stay there for holiday.
This hotel is fine for a night coming or going from the Cancun Airport. It'll get a bit costly once you've had a couple of meals, but it's only one night.
There is no ambiance here, but if you are going to be in the Yucatan from Tulum north, you are probably not looking for ambiance.
The beds were super comfortable, linen fresh, food fabulous, a great breakfast, convenient shuttle service, beautiful garden with a lovely big clean pool.
The staff was great, the breakfast was delicious, with plenty to choose from.

the place is immaculate.

l had already returned my rental car.

Enjoyed the complimentary shuttle service which went well and took the hassle away from trying to find alternatives means of travel to the hotel.

A little expensive for a single nite stay but other than that it was fine.
Everything OK for an airport hotel to stay on late arrival and return next morning to airport to rent car.

If we had read the small print, we would not have been fooled on arrival in Cancun airport by people claiming to be from the hotel who said the shuttle bus was not coming - and  we paid the US$30 demanded for a 10 minute taxi ride to the wrong Marriott Hotel! Buyer beware in Mexico I guess.
bright & clean.
no one to checkout with as 230am or a way to do auto checkout.

The only thing that was a little disorganized was the free shuttle to the airport. We got there on time for our flight but I don't think the hotel was prepared for the amount of people who showed up that morning.

Room was nice for two people.The fact it had free breakfest and free airport shuttle is why we stayed.WIll stay again.
When we went to get the shuttle there was a bunch of us waiting and then a flight crew came down and all of us wee concerned and told no problem another shuttle was coming.
we only had one wash cloth.I went down twice and told them.I called and said I want another washcloth and it was brought up immediately. Not a big deal
location & airport shuttle

Nice and close to the airport with shuttle service that is easy to understand and restaurant located on site, Perfect for a night before/after flight

The shuttle bus was very convenient.The breakfast was very nice .The pool warm and clean.Nice garden with lovely birds

The lovely manicured grounds 
and pool. Great breakfast buffet. Free or cheap long term parking with stay.
The pool was very nice and the garden. The room was good and is near the airport with free shuttle and that was the main purpose of this stay.

Attention - Frozen pizza is the pizza they serve in the hotel. Never happened to me before. I was shock. 
The receptionists were great and the staff in general but the tip thing even in a hotel is too much. The staff asked me for a tip during my buffet breakfast. What in the world...
airport shuttle
Great airport shuttle available 24 hours running every 30 minutes.  The rooms are very nice and modern with comfortable beds.

Small thing but the jets didn't work on the jacuzzi.  Also, there are unfortunately only 2 washers and 2 dryers so if you intend to do laundry try to get in as soon as you check in for a better chance.
at least 2 options of the room service menu werenot available
The bed was comfortable and the room was modern. The restaurant and reception staff were welcoming and memorable. Ivan was a good host in the restaurant; very funny.
Nothing.
The transfer service was great, we called the hotel when we arrived at the airport and the van went to pick us up within 10 minutes. The room was clean and the staff was very friendly.
The location is excellent it's really near to my client's office, the room is extremely comfortable and clean, I had a club sandwich for dinner and it was very good

The free airport shuttle pickup process was super easy and hassle-free. We arrived to/from the airport within 10 minutes each trip. The room was basic but comfortable, fairly quiet despite being close to the airport. The grounds are well kept and beautiful. Free water bottles in the rooms and in the gym.

No complimentary breakfast; there is a restaurant at the lobby but it is a little pricy, as expected for hotel restaurants. Check-in process took a while even though there was only 1 person in front of us at the counter.

the bed was super comfy ! close to the airport and loved the airport transfer as I arrived very late, I used the gym was small but everything you need for a good workout and food was excellent. loved my stay. Incredibly friendly and accomodating. I’d stay here again
shower had hair on the floor that wasn’t mine. not where u stand tho so that was ok.

I like the location because it’s close to the airport the food was great
The clothes dryer didn’t work not heating, also the bathroom shower was not that clean
Bathroom shower not that clean and the smell of the hotel has a strong smell of a cleaner not pleasant

Location was perfect as we had a very early flight 2 days later. Shuttle service excellent. Pool area so inviting.
Restaurant and staff very obliging
Our dinner night one was double the price of dinner night 2

Shuttle met us at the airport and had us to the hotel in 10 minutes. This is our 6th time staying here. We use this as a rejuvenation station when staying at our favorite all-inclusive. We usually arrive late in the afternoon and stay here until the next morning. We arrive at our destination refreshed and ready to enjoy ourselves. It doesn't make sense to spend for an all-inclusive if you can't spend the whole day there.

breakfast buffet is for the price totally fine and has many options. Seating area were comfortable.

Clean property with accessible parking. 
Comfortable beds and spacious rooms.
Paid extra for breakfast which was disappointing.
Location
Could be cleaner and the dining area needs to be upgraded
Location was fine, room was really spacious and well appointed. good size bathroom. very quiet at night despite traffic outside. pool was decent.
staff very slow on check out. breakfast very average.

how helpful they were in helping us settle down, Matteo taking our bags and just asking us what we needed. Really nice restaurant food and good price too also it’s close to the bus station and easy route to the airport.
it’s not the closest to the beach but there is a public bus for like 1 dollar/20 pesos
The staff was super friendly

The room was large and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful (on our last day we had a major issue trying to get an Uber to pick us up but the staff helped us source a taxi and calm us down!). The breakfast is ok, plenty of choice but not replenished enough.

The breakfast was good but it wasn't replenished quickly enough. A few times we had to ask for pastries, butter, cereal, milk, bread, which had all run out - I could understand if it was towards the end of the breakfast period, but this was usually only halfway through. We have a very minor issue with the room as the curtain would not shut properly, so I had to use a clip to clip it together and stop the sun shining in first thing in the morning!

The hotel is very clean, the attitude of the staffs are very good as well. their Mexican-style breakfast buffet is okay during our stay. price is very affordable, and I like the location is great. it is where the tourist bus boards, and many taxis waiting outside. very convenient location with shop, restaurants and big mall near by with 15 minutes walk.
It was clean and the bed was comfortable.
The shower was cold. There was a lot of road construction which made it difficult to get to and not a pleasant view around the area.
underground parking, 15 min drive to the ferry to go to isla Mujeres, leaving bags with lobby whilst going to the island
basic room that is quite old and dated. the bathroom and shower was particular dated. walls are thin can hear outside in the corridor. you paid for what you get.
staff
breakfast is limited and very low quality food
quiet

the room was comfortable, the staff very professional and the breakfast very good!!
well in the hallway no air conditioner!! so hot , and the construction outside so inconvenient!!!
very friendly and clean

Very bad no creen  my room prfali And no shop no shampoo 2 days
Staff  no   frendly alwyas.   Sad mood 😞
Clean, comfortable and affordable stay. Spacious room.
Bit of a walk from central downtown Cancun and the ADO bus station.

Hotel is really old but nice stuff was really friendly and they gave us a better suite room!
Maybe they can make some renewals but it is still good the way it is

Very nice and quiet hotel, excellent value, nice swimmimg pools and a water park (entrance fee to be paid, but discount for the hotel guest), nice beach restaurant with Mexican live music during the evenings, entertaining activities (games, contests) by the pool side for children and adults, room very big, excellent cleaning services (towels and sheets changed every day).
Close to cruises ports to Isla de Mujeres.
Convenient grocery store and pharmacy inside the hotel.

Rooms can use renovation, but are clean and we can't complain for the price paid (approx USD120 per night).
No restaurants/ souvenirs shops near the hotel, but you can take the local bus / taxi to "La Isla" area, aprox 5 km from the hotel where you can find plenty.

The location was amazing. It is perfect for children because you can sit and relax while your kids are at the playground having fun with other kids. A great balance.
The water is shallow and beautiful clear blue. Our view from our room (8th floor) was gorgeous. We love having a kitchen.
The couch and sofa in the bedrooms are really not comfortable. Check-out is at 11 am and if you want to check out later they charged you US$20 per hour. The food at the buffet was so-so.

- towels at the beach
- good wifi even on the beach
- big room
- clean pools

- old furniture
- very noisy
- a lot of seagrass on the beach
Great value
Food was great
Beach location. Lovely & clean. Shallow water. Enjoyed the breakfast set up in the indoor restaurant; well organised & very clean.

I did not like it when serving staff would ask for tips. I felt it was very rude. We found ourselves explaining that we like to tip at the end of our visit. This made myself & partner feel very uncomfortable. On one occasion my husband was challenged by a member of staff; he was asked “if he did not like the service”. (Bearing in mind this was a self service buffet) & the service provided was being shown a seat as you were not allowed to sit anywhere & order a drink. We are very well travelled & never experienced this kind of rudeness. As this was not an all inclusive hotel. Drinks & meals were payed each time of new order. You have an option to pay upfront for a book of 10 meal tickets; which you present at the end or before you go up for food(Also to add, food & drinks were not cheap) If you were to tip every time you purchased a drink over your length of your holiday ie 11 nights. ( it would cost you a small fortune). It was also noted that staff would add their tip on your receipt, so please be vigilant & ask them to remove & not be pressurised. Staff would definitely treat you different when you did not tip. I have since read reviews on this same hotel & this has been highlighted before. 
I did not like how there was not a choice to eat lunch & diner in the indoor restaurant & this is only opened & available at breakfast times. The size of the outside snack/meal room is not big enough for the volume of customers; which meant having to queue. (Pending what time of year you may be visiting & experience interval rain would be a cause for concern).
Big spacious room, nice views, private beach.
Old fashioned furniture, dirty couch.
Large suite on 7th floor of bldg 2. Good views from the two balconies.
Asked for two beds and got one king sized bed with a Murphy bed that was last used in 1981 by the looks of it!
The hotel is situated at a prime beach location.  It has a nice buffet breakfast/lunch/dinner, and a small a-la-carte bar.  Great functional Wi-Fi, and a good list of amenities.
Some of the rooms are a bit aged, the age-conditioner worked but made some loud noises in between temp changes.  Everything else was in agreeable condition.

Breakfast could have been better with more options, the staff was amazing though and very helpful and polite. The pool area was big, but often very crowded with people reserving chairs for hours and not using them. The beach was nice but also a bit crowded. Service at the beach bar was excellent, the drinks from the beach bar was delicious.
Overall the hotel would need some update and refreshing the furniture, curtains etc.

Rooms are clean, the hotel is close everything like 10 minutes driving to coco bongo and clubs area. Service in general was decent, hotel always answered all questions we have. Basically you get what you pay for 
Drinks at the beach are so good too!

Beach is too shallow, then in the deeper water alot of seaweed. 
You will HAVE TO use the safe for your items as my earings were stolen from the room

The rooms exceeded my expectations. The room was very spacious, with a pleasant temperature, a bathroom with a walk in closet, a dining room, kitchen, fridge and balcony. Also, the color of the sea is beautiful.

If you are a person who is sensitive to the way you are spoken to and treated, then this hotel may not be for you. The people in the hotel, except for the bellboys and those at the door, have a very bad attitude; a bad face, they answer badly, and so on. Lastly, the prices of everything in this hotel is way above what you pay in other places in the same area (food, drinks, additional services).  Another thing to take into account is that the hotel's beach is very crowded, it does not have the tranquility and space of the private beaches (especially on weekends, as it is visited by local tourists).
everything I needed was onsite: grocery, restaurant, beach

great location. clean sorroundings
breakfast quite expensive

Everything I expected I've stayed before and I'll stay again
Everything was great, just as the pictures showed. I recommended it as a great experience; the lovely beach and the staff were friendly.

beach
taxi price
Good/central location, very nice and clean beach area (plenty of beach chairs), nice pools, spacious rooms, excellent breakfast, older facilities but good value for money
hardly any pool chairs available, so-so dinner (only tried it once), not many activities for older kids
The ocean view

The restaurant it’s expensive 
I pay for breakfast included But they told me it’s not included
the property was great but needs updating.
The hotel was very clean. The beach and the pool facilities were very nice and relaxing. The front desk were very nice and helpful

It was quite expensive for 3 nights. I booked breakfast included and I was told it was not.  Took some time to fix that it was indeed included.  The room was a studio but didn't look like a studio and it was in dire need of an upgrade.  For a solo female, I felt uncomfortable in that particular room as it had many doors and one was attached to another hotel room.  It was locked but it felt strange and made me nervous.  Also two times in the restaurant near the pool, I was told ...only one,  you have to sit here ( in the corner table) just in case a family wants to sit there.  It was 8.45pm.  Nobody was there nor did anyone else come to eat.    As a solo female it made me feel not welcome!

We loved it!  We are so sad to hear, though,  that the hotel will be taken down and a new "all inclusive" will be built starting in August.  We enjoyed the included breakfast (and that food was great!) however, we enjoy traveling outside the hotel to go on tours, to visit malls and to visit friends.  An "all inclusive" hotel may not work for us so I'm hoping there will be options to stay at Casa Maya in the future, but not have to pay for the "all inclusive".  Also, the beach there is awesome!!  It is so pretty and I loved playing volleyball every day from 3:00 to 5:00 and then relaxing at the pool or on the beach before and afterwards.  I used to live in Cancun and work there too.  I think Casa Maya has one of the nicest beaches.  I hope the new development doesn't change the beach too much.  
The view from our room was SUPER!
Juan, Seline and Gonzalo who were the three people running the sports palapa by the pool were so nice.  They remembered our names (as well as many others' as well) and were always so helpful and nice to make sure we were all having fun.  That kind of treatment makes a guest feel loved and cared for by the staff.
The elevators were super fast.  That was great!!  We didn't have to spend hardly any time waiting for elevators and thus had more time to spend on the beach.

It wasn't a big deal, but we only had the two lights near the beds and the hallway light.  So in the main room (not the bathroom... the light was fine there) it was a little dim at times.  
Also, the last time we stayed there it was a less busy season.  This time it was very busy.  So, even though the people and servers were kind... they didn't have the time to dote on us as before.

- Very nice beach, water is not deep, perfect for children. 
- The beach is north facing in the direction of the lagoon, due to this there is only very little seegrass, even in the seegrass season while other beaches are mountainhigh covered in seegrass.
- Good breakfast
- Good price for what you get

- You can not really swim at the beach, because where it gets deeper there is a line you should not cross. Lots of Jetski and Ships passing by the beach. 
- The restaurant is somewhat underwhelming for the price. And there is practically nothing else around.
- The Hotel and Rooms need a renovation. Everything is in good condition and clean and so, but half of the Hotel is still in original condition from 1980, other half was renovated in the 1990ies. (But probably this is why the price is good for the location, so I will not complain, who needs a room anyway when you can be on the beach the whole day :)) We were told they want to renovate in the next 2 years.
- If you like it quiet, avoid the west facing rooms in building B, as there is a party area near where they play loud music from 9 AM to 10 PM.

Beach was amazing! No seaweed and a small reef down the beach with amazing snorkeling.  
Loved that we were able to get food and drink orders on the beach with staff coming around asking for orders.
Loved the easy access to the hammocks.
Staff were all amazing, truly genuine lovely people.
Our room was large and we all enjoyed the space very much with the two rooms.
The two stores on site where awesome! One for groceries and the other for miscellaneous items.  
Felt very safe at this hotel as security was constantly walking around at all hours.

Menu could have been more extensive, with more choices available. 
Would have liked to have access to the hammock for longer in the evenings.
Seafront

Travelling half of the globe to meet friends and family, and they were forced to pay a day pass just for being at the beach. A hotel should be a host. If I can't receive family, this place is no longer a host for me in Cancun.
It's Value for Money pricing
It's too old
Good location, direct beach, beach snack service, friendly staff, comfortable room
No ventilation in the bathroom. Restaurant not so spectacular for dinner, the breakfast had wide variety though.
Breakfast was amazing with lots of choices and pleasant sea views.  . Rooms are quite  big ; we had a suite, and it was huge. The beach is clean .

People are riding Jetski at really high speed close to the area where people swim, which is very dangerous.  I am not sure how the hotel is allowing such unsafe practices!!!! Also, rooms are in need of remodeling and updating. 
But overall, it is a great value for the money.
The staff were so helpful and nice.

Our room was on the 8th floor with ocean views, and we had a junior suite, which was spacious for a family. The room was renovated and clean, with no carpet; however, it was super noisy. It was annoying, the staff suggested a couple of other rooms, but they weren't renovated and smelled.
I like the room. It was big and comfortable.
The kitchen appliances are old. Specially the dishwasher is extremely old.
swimming pool
the sea point
Room was clean with a beautiful view from the balcony
Тhe room was too noisy apparently due to the general air conditioner
great location /clean
room needs a bit of updating

LOVED the beach right in front of the hotel: perfect sea level; shallow enough for my baby daughter, beautiful water most of our stay, and great beach with enough seating options. Loved the breakfast buffet: great variety and fresh food. Enjoyed the three different pool areas too and the towel services!

The hotel needs some updating and upgrading. You could tell it’s a older hotel from the 80/90s from the decoration in the room, the old full carpet in our room, the infrastructures and cracking walls/humidity on the building. I actually think there must have been some mold under the carpet in our room as I had some bad coughing fits every night while staying there 😬😖
Nice location by the sea, relatively cheap compared to other hotels in the area

Rooms are far away from the pictures advertised (rusty bathroom, 20 years old carpet on the floor, fridge half broken), needed to ask for a change of the room. The hotel is in need of renovation, and the hotel's grocery shop is 3 times the price for groceries

The beautiful private beach, the food!
The decor is definitely outdated and some areas such as the outdoor bar/restaurant were under construction/renovations.
